channel.title: MPC Client help
channel.description:
Yes, I found out the problem. I was using a previous version. Now I cant start my client...
@echo off java -classpath moparclassic-client.jar;lib/xstream.jar;lib/xpp3.jar;lib/MoparScape.jar;lib/defs.jar;lib/hex-string.jar; org.rscdaemon.client pause
I'm getting the error:
Error: Could not find or load main class org.rscdaemon.client
I've changed the main class in the .bat about 4 times now and I cant figure it out

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

oh okay. another problem that randomly popped up, ant seems to have stopped working for all sources and clients. I’ve already tried dling it again but it still wont work, any suggestions? ANT_HOME is set and so is path(yes it has /bin)

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Fear Nuture, post:19, topic:453563”]oh that makes sense lol where is the password file encryption located? I dont know how their encrypted so I don’t think i can just type password for password[/quote]It’s just MD5.

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

oh that makes sense lol where is the password file encryption located? I dont know how their encrypted so I don’t think i can just type password for password

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Fear Nuture, post:17, topic:453563”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=556400.msg4073905#msg4073905 date=1344619727]

[quote author=Fear Nuture link=topic=556400.msg4073883#msg4073883 date=1344619043]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=556400.msg4073517#msg4073517 date=1344573831]

GameServer/conf/world.xml, it says

<!-- Separate names by commas -->
<entry key="pmods">None</entry>
<entry key="mods">None</entry>
<entry key="admins">None</entry>

yet adding names to this list doesn’t seem to add them to staff.
[/quote]That was only to display the names when the command is used. The command was actually removed, so it’s useless now.

But were ranks themselves removed as well? Seeing as commands are rank-based, they’ve got to be somewhere, maybe I’m looking in the wrong spot.
[/quote]It will not be in the config… That makes no sense, seeing it is an attribute of each player.

are they in the Player_Files themselves? If so how would I go about decrypting"
[/quote]Yes. They are not encrypted.

Go look through my posts for the last week because I’ve already explained it several times.

So from reading your last 2 pages worth of posts, I think I may have found what you are talking about.

org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.SerializedStorageMedium
It’s serialized because I’m using this storage medium. I Changed it to

org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL/entry>
and I changed my Auth back to Dummy, but it’s still not allowing me to login with any username/password combination.[/quote]You have to create the MySQL entry before you can log in.

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:16, topic:453563”][quote author=Fear Nuture link=topic=556400.msg4073883#msg4073883 date=1344619043]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=556400.msg4073517#msg4073517 date=1344573831]

[quote author=Fear Nuture link=topic=556400.msg4073512#msg4073512 date=1344573343]

GameServer/conf/world.xml, it says

<!-- Separate names by commas -->
<entry key="pmods">None</entry>
<entry key="mods">None</entry>
<entry key="admins">None</entry>

yet adding names to this list doesn’t seem to add them to staff.
[/quote]That was only to display the names when the command is used. The command was actually removed, so it’s useless now.

But were ranks themselves removed as well? Seeing as commands are rank-based, they’ve got to be somewhere, maybe I’m looking in the wrong spot.
[/quote]It will not be in the config… That makes no sense, seeing it is an attribute of each player.

are they in the Player_Files themselves? If so how would I go about decrypting"
[/quote]Yes. They are not encrypted.

Go look through my posts for the last week because I’ve already explained it several times.[/quote]

So from reading your last 2 pages worth of posts, I think I may have found what you are talking about.

org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.SerializedStorageMedium
It’s serialized because I’m using this storage medium. I Changed it to

org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL/entry>
and I changed my Auth back to Dummy, but it’s still not allowing me to login with any username/password combination.

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Fear Nuture, post:15, topic:453563”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=556400.msg4073517#msg4073517 date=1344573831]

[quote author=Fear Nuture link=topic=556400.msg4073512#msg4073512 date=1344573343]

GameServer/conf/world.xml, it says

<!-- Separate names by commas -->
<entry key="pmods">None</entry>
<entry key="mods">None</entry>
<entry key="admins">None</entry>

yet adding names to this list doesn’t seem to add them to staff.
[/quote]That was only to display the names when the command is used. The command was actually removed, so it’s useless now.

But were ranks themselves removed as well? Seeing as commands are rank-based, they’ve got to be somewhere, maybe I’m looking in the wrong spot.
[/quote]It will not be in the config… That makes no sense, seeing it is an attribute of each player.

are they in the Player_Files themselves? If so how would I go about decrypting"[/quote]Yes. They are not encrypted.

Go look through my posts for the last week because I’ve already explained it several times.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

GameServer/conf/world.xml, it says

<!-- Separate names by commas -->
<entry key="pmods">None</entry>
<entry key="mods">None</entry>
<entry key="admins">None</entry>

yet adding names to this list doesn’t seem to add them to staff.
[/quote]That was only to display the names when the command is used. The command was actually removed, so it’s useless now.

But were ranks themselves removed as well? Seeing as commands are rank-based, they’ve got to be somewhere, maybe I’m looking in the wrong spot.

are they in the Player_Files themselves? If so how would I go about decrypting"

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Fear Nuture, post:13, topic:453563”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=556400.msg4073503#msg4073503 date=1344572767]

GameServer/conf/world.xml, it says

<!-- Separate names by commas -->
<entry key="pmods">None</entry>
<entry key="mods">None</entry>
<entry key="admins">None</entry>

yet adding names to this list doesn’t seem to add them to staff.
[/quote]That was only to display the names when the command is used. The command was actually removed, so it’s useless now.

But were ranks themselves removed as well? Seeing as commands are rank-based, they’ve got to be somewhere, maybe I’m looking in the wrong spot.[/quote]It will not be in the config… That makes no sense, seeing it is an attribute of each player.

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:12, topic:453563”][quote author=Fear Nuture link=topic=556400.msg4073443#msg4073443 date=1344570305]
GameServer/conf/world.xml, it says

<!-- Separate names by commas -->
<entry key="pmods">None</entry>
<entry key="mods">None</entry>
<entry key="admins">None</entry>

yet adding names to this list doesn’t seem to add them to staff.
[/quote]That was only to display the names when the command is used. The command was actually removed, so it’s useless now.[/quote]

But were ranks themselves removed as well? Seeing as commands are rank-based, they’ve got to be somewhere, maybe I’m looking in the wrong spot.

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Fear Nuture, post:9, topic:453563”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=556400.msg4073141#msg4073141 date=1344551064]

I Tried that client but it creates its own server or something. Without the server running, I can connect, which is why I couldnt find player files
[/quote]You need to change the IP address… Also, it’s not creating its own server, you’re connecting to MoparClassic.

I realize that now lol how come adding characters to staff doesnt work?[/quote]What are you talking about?

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

This is the client used for MoparClassic:

GitHub

xetr0v/mpc-client

Contribute to mpc-client development by creating an account on GitHub.

I have one here, but no one is really using it:

GitHub

CodeForFame/Client

Contribute to Client development by creating an account on GitHub.

So, IDK where you’re getting these batch files from…

Read full topic

item.title: MPC Client help
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

Yes, I found out the problem. I was using a previous version. Now I cant start my client…

@echo off
java -classpath moparclassic-client.jar;lib/xstream.jar;lib/xpp3.jar;lib/MoparScape.jar;lib/defs.jar;lib/hex-string.jar; org.rscdaemon.client
pause

I’m getting the error:

Error: Could not find or load main class org.rscdaemon.client

I’ve changed the main class in the .bat about 4 times now and I cant figure it out

Read full topic
